intro: Elatostema subtrichotomum, commonly known as the small-leaf elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are usually covered in fine, short hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Elatostema subtrichotomum is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often used in traditional medicine.
